summary: This is a federal indictment filed against correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas for conspiracy and making false records related to their failure to conduct mandated inmate counts and rounds at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 9-10, 2019, during which time inmate Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide while unobserved. This is a federal indictment filed in the Southern District of New York against two Bureau of Prisons correctional officers, Tova Noel and Michael Thomas. It charges them with conspiracy and making false records related to failing to perform required inmate counts in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on or around August 10, 2019, while Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated there.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: Indicted for conspiracy and falsifying records by failing to perform required inmate counts and rounds in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) on August 9-10, 2019, during which Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: Indicted alongside Noel for conspiracy and falsifying records by failing to perform required inmate counts and rounds in the SHU on August 9-10, 2019; was present during Epstein's prior apparent suicide attempt on July 23, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Incarcerated at MCC on sex trafficking charges; found dead by suicide in his SHU cell on August 10, 2019, after officers failed to conduct required checks; had a prior apparent suicide attempt on July 23, 2019.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: The United States Attorney who signed and filed the indictment in the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Worked together as the only two officers on duty in the SHU from 12 a.m. to 8 a.m. on August 10, 2019; jointly failed to perform counts and rounds, falsified records, and made admissions of fault to a supervisor.
Noel was one of the correctional officers responsible for monitoring Epstein in the SHU; she escorted him to his cell on the evening of August 9 and was on duty when he died.
Thomas was one of the officers who responded to Epstein's prior apparent suicide attempt on July 23, 2019, and was on duty in the SHU when Epstein died on August 10, 2019.
Both were correctional officers at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, assigned to the Special Housing Unit (SHU).

events.title: Epstein's Apparent Suicide Attempt
events.description: MCC officers, including Michael Thomas, responded to an emergency call and found Epstein on the floor of his SHU cell with a strip of bedsheet around his neck. He was subsequently placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Failure to Perform 4 p.m. and 10 p.m. Counts
events.description: Tova Noel, along with other officers (Officer-1 and Officer-2), failed to conduct the mandated 4 p.m. and 10 p.m. institutional counts in the SHU but signed false count slips certifying they had been performed.

events.title: Failure to Perform Overnight Counts and Rounds
events.description: From 12 a.m. to 6:30 a.m., Tova Noel and Michael Thomas failed to conduct the 12 a.m., 3 a.m., and 5 a.m. institutional counts and all required 30-minute rounds in the SHU, instead browsing the internet and appearing to sleep, while falsifying all related records.

events.title: Discovery of Epstein's Body
events.description: At approximately 6:33 a.m., after entering Epstein's tier to serve breakfast, Noel and Thomas found Epstein unresponsive with a noose around his neck. An alarm was activated and a supervisor responded.

events.title: Admissions to Supervisor
events.description: After discovering Epstein's body, Noel told a supervisor 'we did not complete the 3 a.m. nor 5 a.m. rounds.' Thomas stated, 'we messed up,' and 'I messed up, she's not to blame, we didn't do any rounds.'

events.title: False Count Slips Submitted
events.description: Correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas allegedly created, signed, and submitted false count slips indicating they had performed the 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. institutional counts of the SHU when they had not done so.

events.title: Indictment Filed
events.description: The indictment against Tova Noel and Michael Thomas was filed in the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York.

locations: MCC Special Housing Unit (SHU), ninth floor
keyFacts: Correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas are charged with conspiracy and making false records for failing to perform any mandated inmate counts or rounds in the MCC's Special Housing Unit from approximately 10:30 p.m. on August 9, 2019, until 6:30 a.m. on August 10, 2019.

Jeffrey Epstein was found dead by suicide in his cell during this period of no monitoring. The last time anyone approached his tier before his body was discovered was at approximately 10:30 p.m. on August 9.

Noel and Thomas falsified count slips for five institutional counts (4 p.m., 10 p.m., 12 a.m., 3 a.m., 5 a.m.) and Noel falsified over 75 entries for 30-minute rounds, leading the MCC to believe inmates were being monitored.

Video surveillance confirmed the officers did not perform the required checks; instead, they sat at their desk, browsed the internet (for furniture sales, motorcycles, sports news), and appeared to sleep for about two hours.

Epstein had been placed in the SHU due to suicidality risk and, after a prior apparent suicide attempt on July 23, 2019, was supposed to have a cellmate, but was alone on the night of his death because his cellmate was transferred out and not replaced.
Two Bureau of Prisons correctional officers, Tova Noel and Michael Thomas, were federally indicted for falsifying records related to inmate counts in the SHU.
The alleged false records were created and submitted on or about August 10, 2019, the same month Jeffrey Epstein died in custody at the MCC.
The charges include conspiracy to defraud the United States and making false records (violations of Title 18, U.S. Code, Sections 371, 1001(a)(3), and 2).
The indictment specifically accuses them of falsifying slips for the 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. institutional counts, indicating a failure to perform required security checks.
The document is a formal indictment, indicating the initiation of a criminal prosecution by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
